title: Ways to improve league culture
body:
I was thinking of ways to try and clean up some of the more toxic sides of our "culture".
Maybe Riot for one could make a series of some sort to show players new and old about various ways of being toxic and how its problematic, because as we all know all types of toxicity has a negative effect on game outcomes even if they can appear minor at times.
Can i have some suggestions to on what other ways to improve?

replies.body: Ban the entire Chinese region. League has become almost unplayable as of recent, every game i have players who dont speak English, spam "sb" and die upwards of 6 times a game. never used to be a problem till recent

>
> Ban the entire Chinese region. League has become almost unplayable as of recent, every game i have players who dont speak English, spam "sb" and die upwards of 6 times a game. never used to be a problem till recent

I don't know how "recent" you mean, but it's been a growing problem on a lot of platforms, not just league. though it is a definite problem, i also think their views on "naming and shaming" are a bit skewed, i mean if you make the one named and shamed a pariah, because of their behaviour, even if its a list of people that have been banned in the last two weeks or something, they would pick up pretty quick because people don't want to play with a dickhead.

improve the community by letting people say gg ez.
if this makes you angry, your skin is too thin, and you won't live a happy life because all the mean people will get to you.
by allowing people to say gg ez, we will desensitize people and they will be able to deal with the assholes of the world instead of being cry bullies and trying to shut them up because their opinion is different.

the game breeds toxicity people troll in ranked or feed and afk or any number of things just to ruin someone elses game and out comes the toxicity in most people you just have to put up with toxic players like feeders etc its a part of the game more so in lower elo

The thing that makes me feel most proud to be a league gamer, and least likely to be detrimental to the game in any way; 
Is when I listen to songs like Get Jinxed, Warriors, and Ignite. etc. It makes me really proud that I belong to this group of people.

I think more of this kind of thing would be brilliant for morale in game. It shows people that League isn't just a game, its a whole culture, with music, art, cosplay etc. And when you feel like your part of a culture, you respect it more. 

Rather than excluding people through harsher punishments, I think we should be focusing on building the league culture and community. 
It could just be my imagination, but I notice less toxicity during events like Ocean Week. I believe that being part of a community striving for a goal, makes people more respectful of each other, and songs/videos like Get Jinxed and Ignite, remind people that league doesn't happen only on the rift.

And its so easy to rally people behind a catchy song.

I also It would be nice to somehow bring the Boards, and In-game communities closer. (there are people talked to on here for years, and have never played with.) I think some of the Volunteers are really making an effort though, its great, and id encourage people to join them:
https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/team-recruitment/IBUY7Hn7-join-the-arbiters-and-league-volunteers-on-discord
I feel like harsher penalties for intent feeding and a tribunal system instead of this dumb ass automatic system needs to be implemented.
